articles.title: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque - BBC
articles.description: It is the first time Leo has attended a Muslim place of worship since he took up the papacy in May.

articles.author: F1
articles.title: Piastri charges to dominant Sprint victory in Qatar ahead of Russell and Norris - Formula 1
articles.description: Oscar Piastri stormed to a commanding victory in the Qatar Sprint, comprehensively beating George Russell and the second McLaren of Lando Norris in the 19-lap event.

articles.title: Louisiana prison "father-daughter dance" restores family bonds and heals wounds - CBS News
articles.description: The prison picked nearly 30 inmates to participate in the "father-daughter" dance at the Louisiana State Penitentiary.

articles.author: Mark Torregrossa | mtorregr@mlive.com
articles.title: Michigan Snowstorm: Saturday update increases Winter Storm Warnings, slight tweak for Detroit, Ann Arbor - MLive.com
articles.description: Here's a complete look at the snowstorm heading into the Great Lakes State today, tonight and Sunday.

articles.author: Dustin Racioppi
articles.title: Seton Hall abuse investigation stalls after ex-president’s aborted interview - Politico
articles.description: An attorney for former president Joseph Nyre said the New Jersey school is trying to “silence the truth.”

articles.author: Dan Diamond, Rachel Roubein
articles.title: FDA to impose strict new vaccine requirements, claiming child covid shot deaths - The Washington Post
articles.description: Vinay Prasad, the nation’s top vaccine regulator, said his team concluded that coronavirus shots were linked to children’s deaths, necessitating a new approach.

articles.author: Kerry  Breen
articles.title: A toddler was given just 3 years to live after his mom noticed worrying symptoms. He proved everyone wrong. - CBS News
articles.description: Meghan Jenkins' son was 2 years old when he was diagnosed with cancer in 2021. His prognosis was grim, but aggressive treatment saved his life.

articles.author: Mike Andronico
articles.title: I’ve found the 19 best Black Friday laptop and computer deals that are still alive - CNN
articles.description: Don’t buy just any computer this Black Friday. Our PC expert picked out the laptop and computer deals that are actually worth shopping based on his extensive hands-on experience.

articles.author: Ben Turner
articles.title: Science news this week: An enigmatic human relative, dark matter discovery and mysterious lights in the sky during nuclear weapons tests - Live Science
articles.description: Nov. 29, 2025: Our weekly roundup of the latest science in the news, as well as a few fascinating articles to keep you entertained over the weekend.

articles.title: Andriy Yermak: How Zelensky's right-hand man fell from power - BBC
articles.description: A widening corruption scandal has forced the resignation of Ukraine's second most powerful person.

articles.author: Frank Landymore
articles.title: Scientists Claim to Detect Dark Matter for the First Time Ever - Futurism
articles.description: A team of astronomers say they've made the first ever detection of dark matter by examining gamma rays near the center of the Milky Way.

articles.title: Airbus: Flights resume as normal after software update warning - BBC
articles.description: Around 6,000 planes were affected after an issue that could corrupt data was discovered.

articles.author: Athlon Sports
articles.title: College Football Picks: Predictions for Week 14’s Biggest Saturday Games - Athlon Sports

articles.author: Allyson Chiu
articles.title: The common vaccines that can prevent chronic disease or some cancers - The Washington Post
articles.description: In addition to cancer, a growing body of research has shown that vaccines can reduce the risk of developing dementia and heart conditions.

articles.author: Sarah Ventre
articles.title: Where things stand with the National Guard shooting in D.C. - NPR
articles.description: The Trump administration has halted the processing of immigration requests from Afghans and the president vowed to tighten his immigration crackdown after the shooting of two National Guard members.

articles.author: Ellise Shafer
articles.title: Jenna Ortega Says It’s ‘Very Easy to Be Terrified’ of AI: ‘It Feels Like We’ve Opened Pandora’s Box,’ but ‘There’s Certain Things It’s Just Not Able to Replicate’ - Variety
articles.description: Jenna Ortega sounded off on artificial intelligence at the Marrakech Film Festival, saying "it's very easy to be terrified" of it.

articles.author: Michael David Smith
articles.title: Ben Johnson: Bears’ win over Eagles doesn’t happen without our offensive line - NBC Sports
articles.description: Johnson made a point after the game of mentioning left tackle Ozzy Trapilo, left guard Joe Thuney, center Drew Dallman, right guard Jonah Jackson and right tackle Darnell Wright.

articles.author: Frances Vinall, David Nakamura
articles.title: U.S. halts all asylum decisions, pauses visas for Afghan nationals - The Washington Post
articles.description: The decisions come a day after President Donald Trump vowed to “permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries,” among other threats.

articles.author: Sheena Vasani
articles.title: The best Black Friday deals you can still get on AirTags, iPad, and other Apple gear - The Verge
articles.description: Black Friday 2025 is bringing steep discounts on both current and last-gen Apple gadgets. From AirPods to iPads, here are the best Apple deals still available.

aiSummary:
Top news headlines reveal a mix of significant geopolitical developments, critical health policy shifts, and domestic concerns.

Internationally, Pope Leo made a historic visit to Istanbul's Blue Mosque, marking his first attendance at a Muslim place of worship since taking the papacy, signaling efforts in interfaith dialogue. Concurrently, Ukraine faces political instability as a widening corruption scandal forced the resignation of Andriy Yermak, Zelensky's powerful right-hand man. A major health policy shift is anticipated in the U.S. as the FDA plans to impose strict new vaccine requirements, with the nation's top vaccine regulator claiming a link between child COVID shots and deaths.

Domestically, a stalled abuse investigation at Seton Hall University is drawing scrutiny, with accusations that the school is attempting to "silence the truth" from its former president. Meanwhile, a positive human interest story emerged from a Louisiana prison, where a "father-daughter dance" aimed to restore family bonds. On the weather front, Michigan is bracing for a significant snowstorm with increased winter storm warnings. Other news includes Oscar Piastri's dominant Formula 1 Sprint victory, a toddler's inspiring recovery from a grim cancer prognosis, and the ongoing push for Black Friday tech deals. Scientific headlines rounded out the week with discussions on an enigmatic human relative, dark matter, and mysterious lights during nuclear weapons tests.
